review_title: One of the best colleges to work at
pros: Amazing people, great students, great life/work balance, pretty much everything but the lower state worker pay
cons: Lowish salary, and you need to accrue vacation and sick time

pros: Union job Great culture and education
cons: Not as friendly as they lead you to believe A lot of management roles and advancement roles are through nepotism and not qualification. Many people who have worked long term don’t get advancement in their roles. Also, credit is mostly distributed to upper management when they don’t always deserve it.

review_title: You get to work with a student one on one.
pros: If you felt confident in your ability in one of your classes you can put that as your tutoring subject and you can select multiple subjects. It is really interesting to meet all sorts of students and you actually get to learn more about the subject as you teach others.
cons: If you don't have common subjects to teach you can look at around 2-3 hours of doing noting during your shift. But you will sometimes get way too many people during your shift.

job_title: Information Technology Specialist in Bloomington, MN
pros: Community, work environment, location, convenience
cons: Average pay, not a lot of growth opportunity

pros: Excellent support from, and comradery with, supervisory administration.
cons: While credential requirements may differ, it is possible lateral work in a different field, or perhaps even a more prestigious institution in higher ed, would pay more.

pros: You participate in the states benefits programs.
cons: Many need to provide support for legacy systems.

pros: Good experience, great leadership, enjoyable work
cons: Low wage, but that's to be expected

review_title: One of My Most Favorite Jobs Ever
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Paul, MN
pros: I got to work with other student workers. I got to close the computer labs down, and I got to work with a Ticketing System that I absolutely loved along with starid admin and solarwinds to tell when the printers needed new ink.
cons: There really weren't any cons

review_title: A good way to get your feet wet in tutoring
pros: Mostly student run, friendly staff, large variety of tutor positions
cons: There are currently not many tutors available, so workload may be higher

review_title: Normandale: Good for Faculty and Administrators; Bad for Staff
pros: Giving back to the community.  Being a part of something more than a profit bottom line.
cons: State employees are compensated on longevity instead of performance.  Management is too afraid to deal with employees - feel it's easier to ignore bad employees than go through the red tape involved in holding them accountable or firing them.  Administration does not respect or value staff - it's as if faculty are gods and they know it.

pros: Lively campus, with lots of areas for students and faculty to meet between classes. Nice support staff, but I rarely went to that office.
cons: Parking is insufficient. Adjunct faculty pay union dues but have zero benefits if they teach only one class, which amounts to taxation without representation! Faculty with 2 classes were canceling classes frequently with no financial penalty, while my pay was docked for one class when I was extremely ill. Passive-aggressive management style in my department. Insufficient office space for adjuncts to meet with students privately.

pros: Great students, fair amount of resources, we can now use a color copier
cons: Faculty aren't given the same support, independence, or respect as at other academic institutions I've worked at.  There is no chance to get an "unlimited" position - you have to bow and scrape to get classes every semester and only find out what they are about a week or two before classes start.

pros: Great faculty community, competitive pay for adjuncts (however one would be paid much more in a non-teaching field, no surprise there), variety of student backgrounds make for interesting teaching opportunities and a sense of truly making a difference
cons: Casual work environment comes with some downsides - people occasionally take advantage and it takes time to integrate into the community.

review_title: Love the job, new president worries me
pros: Staff and faculty are concerned about the students before all else. Great location and great buildings.
cons: The new president is going to run the place into the ground but she puts on such a great act it is hard to imagine.

pros: The schedule was flexible and the other people working in the tutoring center were all very kind.
cons: Some students come in looking for answers rather than assistance and get upset when you don’t give them what they want.

pros: Welcoming, inclusive organization committed to improving the lives of students.
cons: Pay could be better, which is true of colleges in general.

review_title: Great place to work, but little pay
job_title: Assistant Client Manager in Austin, TX
pros: Wonderful staff and work culture.
cons: Pay wasn't the best, could barely afford to live off of it.

pros:
pay
good people
time and a half overtime
cons:
long days
either hectic or boring, not much in between

review_title: Great place and is very flexible
pros: Benefits, friendliness, caring, vacations and great training
cons: Is quiet during the summer

pros:
Keep subject knowledge up to date
Keep learning while teaching
Improve interpersonal skills

cons: No cons. Seriously, no cons at all.

pros: Easy hiring process, friendly environment, very light work for a part-time dentist or dental Specialist.
cons: Far from place of living?

pros: Good pay for no prior experience.
cons: Labor intensive, if you're not able-bodied do not try to be a groundskeeper.

pros: Very flexible hours and great coworkers
cons: You start out at minimum wage
